title: Photos: Toronto polar bear dippers - Toronto Star
text: Search the print archives Sections This copy is for your personal non-commercial use only. To order presentation-ready copies of Toronto Star content for distribution to colleagues, clients or customers, or inquire about permissions/licensing, please go to: www.TorontoStarReprints.com GTA Photos: Toronto polar bear dippers More than 600 people dared to take a dip in the cold waters of Lake Ontario on New Yearâ€™s Day, this Sunday. The Polar Bear Dip, organized by Habitat for Humanity, is intended to raise money for the organization to help support low-income families. The charity builds houses for them, with the help of volunteers, sponsors and donors. More than $65,000 had been raised as of Sunday evening. Hundreds of people stepped, or ran, into the frigid waters of Lake Ontario today in the Toronto Polar Bear Dip with funds raised supporting Toronto's Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo A young man heads back to shore after having dunked himself. Hundreds of people stepped, or ran, into the frigid waters of Lake Ontario today in the Toronto Polar Bear Dip with funds raised supporting Toronto's Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo A group of men sport tutus for the swim during Sunday's Toronto Polar Bear Dip, with funds raised supporting Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Janet Joy Wilson (in black hat) high-fives people around her Sunday before the big splash. Hundreds of people stepped, or ran, into the frigid waters of Lake Ontario today in the Toronto Polar Bear Dip with funds raised supporting Toronto's Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo A man wears his Happy new Year headgear before hitting the water. Hundreds of people stepped, or ran, into the frigid waters of Lake Ontario today in the Toronto Polar Bear Dip with funds raised supporting Toronto's Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Hundreds of people stepped, or ran, into the frigid waters of Lake Ontario Sun in the Toronto Polar Bear Dip with funds raised supporting Toronto's Habitat for Humanity. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Since 2005 the Toronto Polar Bear Club has raised almost $370,000. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo One of the dippers seems to be enjoying the water, staying out while most others had returned to shore. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Pradeep Nagra brought along a tin foil version of the Stanley Cup for the swim. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Toronto's Polar Bear Club raised $6,000 in their first run, in 2006. ( Rick Madonik / Toronto Star ) | Order this photo Sun., Jan. 1, 2017 More from the Toronto Star & Partners LOADING
